etymology.description: semantic: 衣 ‘clothes’ + 又 ‘hand’; variants added 〇 (now 口) as a phonetic from 圓; 又 later altered to 㞢/土 in later scripts. Originally depicted ‘to put on clothes; to wear’ (original form of 擐).
etymology.interpretation: Portrays a hand putting on clothing, expressing the act of wearing; this image underlies its early use as the form later written 擐. Over time, scribal changes reshaped 又 into forms like 㞢/土, and some variants borrowed 口 from 圓 as a phonetic cue, which aligns with the Yuán reading.

examples.chinese: 袁先生今天来了(袁先生今天來了)。
我认识一位叫袁华的同学(我認識一位叫袁華的同學)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ rènshi yí wèi jiào Yuán Huá de tóngxué.
examples.english: I know a classmate named Yuan Hua.

examples.chinese: 袁家祖籍在山东(袁家祖籍在山東)。
examples.english: The Yuan family’s ancestral home is in Shandong.
